statement:
Let $E\subset W$ where $W$ is a normed vector space, $f\in C^1(E)$ is a
continuous differentiable map $f: E \to W$. Furthermore consider the
ordinary differential equation $$\dot{x} = f(x)$$ with the initial
condition

$x(0) = x_0$.

For all $x_0 \in E$ there exists a unique solution $$x:I \to E$$ where
$I = [-a,a]$, which also satify the initial condition of the initial
value problem. Then there exists a maximal interval of existence
$J=( \alpha ,\beta )$ such that $I\subset J$ and there exists a unique
solution

$x:J \to E$.
names: maximal interval of existence of ordinary differential equations
